notes: Carbon gets hit by a car. The driver didn't even stop. Zofia brings Carbi to the Mundo Mascota clinic in San Cristóbal. Dr. Juan José takes an X-ray. Comminuted fracture. Dr. Juan José says he is not able to operate on our dog and sends us to Tuxtla Gutierrez to Dr. Joe Miceli Fernandez, best doctor in Chiapas, one of the best in Mexico.
Carbi in the clinic in observation. Zofia making phone calls with the doctors: stool and urine are fine, his condition is stable, he will be operated tomorrow.
1st SURGERY: intramedullary pin and cerclage wiring installed plus outside fixture to immobilize the femur X-ray X-ray
Carbon in the clinic
Carbon in the clinic
Picked up Carbon from the clinic
Carbi at home
Dr. Marina came for house-call: suspected inflammation. Brought Carbon back to clinic to be checked. Pic1, Pic2, Pic3
Carbon in the clinic
Picked up Carbon from the clinic Pic1, Pic2, Pic3
Dr. Marina took out the drainage tube and removed the stitches
Checkup with Dr. Miceli, wound looking good, everything fine, next appointment in two weeks

Went to Dr. Marina's office office because we heard cracking noises in Carbon's leg. Carbi received 1 ml of Xilacina (Xylazine sold as Rompun by Bayer) to calm him for his X-ray. Even though he was sedated he still fought to not allow us to turn him on his back, which might have contributed to the leg noise becoming louder X-ray
Miceli didn't like the new fissure in the bone he saw in the X-ray; assistants took Carbon to the next room to inject him with a pain killer and Carbon fell off the table!
Carbi back at home, eating again after many days without appetite, still some clicking in the bone
Dr Miceli on holidays so concerned about the crackling sound in his leg we went to Mundo Mascota, Dr. Juan Jose's clinic, nice guy, didn't want payment for services, cut Carbon's nails

Checkup with Dr. Miceli, external fixation removed (it started moving on its own a bit), Got anesthesia (Ketamine) to take X-ray, bone looks good, muscles atrophied in front and contracted in back; Dr. Miceli told us how to start physiotherapy; week-1 therapy: 15 min warm the leg, 15 min knee-joint ROM, 15 min hip ROM; week-2 therapy: 15 min warming the leg with towels soaked in hot water (moist heat), 30 min whole leg ROM
Started rehab following Dr. Miceli's instructions
Carbon started to be able to sit down (with the one leg still extended)
Carbon is starting to sit down from standing nicely
No rehab today

Checkup with Dr. Miceli; no rehab today; Skin cut open and because the pin moved up a bit the end was cut off and the skin stitched back up; we slept overnight in Tuxtla in the bus in the nice place down by the river X-ray
Picked up Carbi and went back home to San Cristóbal. No rehab today.
Rehab w/ knee still
Rehab w/ knee still
Stopped rehab with the joint and now just massaging the muscles
Miceli diagnosed Carbon with <b>'nonunion'<b> and we scheduled PrP treatment for next week
Zofia made a mustard seed bag (instead of wet towels) to use for heating Carbon's leg
Dr. Micelis clinic: Dropped Carbon off for his Platelet-rich Plasma (PrP) treatment
2nd SURGERY: Installing the X-pins lengthwise inside the femur shaft on top of the intramedullary pin to immobilize the femur better.
He stayed in the clinic a little longer than expected due to excess inflammation X-ray X-ray
Picked Carbi up from Dr. Miceli with X-pins installed
The main intramedullary pin poked through the skin
Dr. Rolando visited Carbi at home and stitched up the skin around the pin
Intramedullary pin poked out of the skin again. So stressful. We are going to the clinic tomorrow.
The intramedullary pin moving. Dr. Miceli said we still need the pin so lets fix it with another screw. Carbi stayed in the clinic awaiting his operation in two days.
3rd SURGERY: Carbon got yet another screw installed to secure the intramedullary pin
Carbi still in the clinic Dr. Miceli said on the phone he wants him for longer observation to make sure the new pin doesn't move
Carbi still in the clinic. Zofia got asked by Dr. Miceli to photograph & send him all the xrays so he can consult with his maestro about a possible solution
X-ray
Carbi in still in the clinic waiting for his next operation scheduled for Oct 11th

4th SURGERY: To remove screws and install a metal plate by Miceli's maestro Dr. Beremiz Sánchez. The metal implant will have to stay in his body for about 6 months. The bone regeneration process will be monitored with x-rays. Carbi also his second PrP during the operation. X-ray X-ray
3rd PrP, this time injected PrP
4th PrP, injected

Picked Carbon up from the clinic. He is happy to be at home after 43 days he's spent in the clinic. He has calluses on his elbow and knee on the healthy side that he is always laying in. He must have been laying on some hard cage bottom the whole time. Zofi started applying urea cream to get rid of the calluses and of course he got his comfy bed back.
We continued with the muscle and joint physiotherapy at home. The femur with the metal plate installed is now very stable. We are so happy!
Started slow controlled leash walks
Checkup - Dr. Miceli: Everything looking great :)
Half rehab today: only muscle massage, no joint flexing
Zofia bought a low level laser device (RIKTA Esmil 2A) on ebay to use in physiotherapy.
Checkup - Dr. Miceli: Looking good! :)

Our low level laser device cannot be sent by mail by Mexican law just as any medical device. Flights are cheep on January 1st so Steven is going to the States to pick it up along with some high quality supplements and essential oils... at the same time he will have a chance to see his family.
Steven brought a low-level laser device from the States and today Carbon started receiving his laser therapy. Tri-Flex is now replaced by TopDog supplement
Checkup - Dr. Miceli: The fracture is united! :) X-ray X-ray X-ray
Carbon started actually walking - he is really using his leg! Is the laser helping? :)
Zofia made a short movie for family and friends showing Carbon walking: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4l84EhFfagc
Alicia came over and gave Carbon Reiki & a Bach flower remedy

Checkup - Dr. Miceli: Soon we can schedule removal of the implant. Dr. Beremiz Sánchez will be coming from Mexico City to operate since he initially installed the implant. Dr. Miceli said the metal plate is a bit long coming almost all the way down to the knee and a callus started bilding close to the knee. When the implant is out Carbi will feel a real difference and will surely use the leg more. With time the callus will get reabsorbed. X-ray X-ray
5th SURGERY: Implant removal. All metal is out: center pin, plate, 7 screws

Picked up Carbi from the clinic. Dr. Miceli commented that the bone is strong and Carbi is using his leg now more then before and really pushing himself of the floor with it. Carbi got brought out from the back of the clinic by one of the assistants. When he saw us, he go a bit excited and tried to put his leg on the floor with more strenght and cried. We brought him home, the leg was dangling while he was walking. Zofia started gently massaging his leg at home, he did not like it. While lifting his leg by the feet gently up, it was coming up from the middle of the femur and not from the hip joint. Zofia suspects a fracture.
Carbon not using his leg. Zofia still suspects a fracture.
Carbon occasionally crying while he is trying to lay down or get up.
Scheduled a visit for tomorrow to get his leg x-rayed.
Suspicion confirmed: 're-fracture' :( We are heartbroken :( X-ray
Zofia wrote to Dr. Miceli yesterday but he is at a veterinary conference in Mérida and didn't answer yet. He will be back in his clinic next Wednesday. We got an appointment scheduled.

We are still thinking what to do. The options are: going back to Dr. Miceli (40 miles away), going to a hospital in Mexico City (550 miles away) or going to San Diego in the US (2300 miles away). Still no answer from Dr. Miceli.
Today Steven contacted Rainy from a clinic in San Diego. We will be sending them a link to this site and waiting for their treatment plan and estimate.
